title: Iran launches missile attack on Israel for killing of Hezbollah leader, general
content: Israel launched a ground incursion into Lebanon as part of an attack on Hezbollah, the militant group backed by Iran.
summary: Israel launched a ground incursion into Lebanon as part of an attack on Hezbollah, the militant group backed by Iran.

title: Port strike could reignite inflation, with larger economic impact dependent on how long it lasts
content: Manufacturers of everything from trucks to toys to artificial Christmas trees face obstacles now that the ILA has called a stoppage.
summary: Manufacturers of everything from trucks to toys to artificial Christmas trees face obstacles now that the ILA has called a stoppage.

title: A historic strike is underway at U.S. ports — and the impact on global supply chains could be huge
content: A massive dockworker strike at seaports on the U.S. East and Gulf coasts is expected to wreak havoc on global supply chains and the economy.
summary: A massive dockworker strike at seaports on the U.S. East and Gulf coasts is expected to wreak havoc on global supply chains and the economy.

title: Nike reports earnings after the bell. Here's what Wall Street expects
content: Nike is in a reset after critics say it lost sight of innovation and ceded share to competitors. Its CEO, John Donahoe, is scheduled to step down this month.
summary: Nike is in a reset after critics say it lost sight of innovation and ceded share to competitors. Its CEO, John Donahoe, is scheduled to step down this month.

title: NATO's new chief will have to confront threats outside the alliance — and within
content: As Mark Rutte becomes NATO's new General Secretary, his leadership skills will be put to the test quickly as the bloc confronts external and internal threats.
summary: As Mark Rutte becomes NATO's new General Secretary, his leadership skills will be put to the test quickly as the bloc confronts external and internal threats.

title: European markets close lower as investors eye Middle East tensions; oil prices jump 4%
content: European stocks closed lower Tuesday, erasing earlier gains amid heightened fears of a possible attack on Israel by Iran.
summary: European stocks closed lower Tuesday, erasing earlier gains amid heightened fears of a possible attack on Israel by Iran.

title: Port strike fallout: Blockbuster weight-loss drug supply from Wegovy to Ozempic, Mounjaro, Zepbound caught up in East Coast trade shutdown
content: Booming demand for blockbuster weight-loss drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro is being tested by a ports strike hitting import hubs for Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.
summary: Booming demand for blockbuster weight-loss drugs like Ozempic and Mounjaro is being tested by a ports strike hitting import hubs for Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.

title: Saudi Arabia slashes growth forecasts, sees wider budget deficits
content: Saudi Arabia's real GDP is expected to grow 0.8% this year, a dramatic drop from a previous estimate of 4.4%, according to the latest government figures.
summary: Saudi Arabia's real GDP is expected to grow 0.8% this year, a dramatic drop from a previous estimate of 4.4%, according to the latest government figures.

title: With shares at 10-year lows, Assassin's Creed maker Ubisoft faces questions over its future
content: Gaming firm Ubisoft is facing questions over its future amid a lackluster games pipeline and pressure from an activist investor to sell itself and go private.
summary: Gaming firm Ubisoft is facing questions over its future amid a lackluster games pipeline and pressure from an activist investor to sell itself and go private.

title: 'Golden Week’ bookings show Chinese travel preferences are evolving
content: Bookings show that Chinese travelers are staying longer, traveling farther and looking for new experiences — from quiet destinations to K-pop concerts.
summary: Bookings show that Chinese travelers are staying longer, traveling farther and looking for new experiences — from quiet destinations to K-pop concerts.

title: Mastercard to buy Swedish startup that makes it easier to manage and cancel subscription plans
content: The payments giant touted the deal as a way to help consumers with a key pain point — managing the myriad subscription services that exist today.
summary: The payments giant touted the deal as a way to help consumers with a key pain point — managing the myriad subscription services that exist today.

title: Abu Dhabi's ADNOC to acquire German chemicals firm Covestro for $16.4 billion
content: Abu Dhabi's state oil firm ADNOC announced it will buy German firm Covestro in a 14.7 billion-euro deal ($16.4 billion).
summary: Abu Dhabi's state oil firm ADNOC announced it will buy German firm Covestro in a 14.7 billion-euro deal ($16.4 billion).

title: Here’s why Japan’s stocks are plunging after Shigeru Ishiba’s win
content: Shigeru Ishida had beaten Economic Security Minister Sanae Takaichi in the final round of the Liberal Democratic Party election on Friday.
summary: Shigeru Ishida had beaten Economic Security Minister Sanae Takaichi in the final round of the Liberal Democratic Party election on Friday.

title: Charles Schwab CEO Walt Bettinger to retire at end of 2024, Rick Wurster to replace him
content: After 16 years leading the brokerage firm, Bettinger will be replaced by an internal CEO hire.
summary: After 16 years leading the brokerage firm, Bettinger will be replaced by an internal CEO hire.

title: Euro zone inflation falls to 1.8% in September, below the European Central Bank's 2% target
content: Euro zone inflation fell to 1.8%, below the European Central Bank's target rate, in September, flash data from statistics agency Eurostat showed Tuesday.
summary: Euro zone inflation fell to 1.8%, below the European Central Bank's target rate, in September, flash data from statistics agency Eurostat showed Tuesday.

title: London-based Robinhood rival Freetrade buys UK arm of Australian investing platform Stake
content: British retail investing app Freetrade has entered into an agreement with Australian rival Stake to take on all of the company's U.K. clients and their assets.
summary: British retail investing app Freetrade has entered into an agreement with Australian rival Stake to take on all of the company's U.K. clients and their assets.

title: Chinese EV brands Li Auto and Zeekr report record deliveries for September
content: Nio, BYD, Xiaomi and Aito, co-developed by Huawei, had yet to release September deliveries as of Tuesday afternoon.
summary: Nio, BYD, Xiaomi and Aito, co-developed by Huawei, had yet to release September deliveries as of Tuesday afternoon.

title: Cybersecurity firm Proofpoint considers pre-IPO funding as it plots a return to public markets
content: It would mark the second time Proofpoint has gone public after the company was acquired in 2021 by private equity firm Thoma Bravo for $12.3 billion.
summary: It would mark the second time Proofpoint has gone public after the company was acquired in 2021 by private equity firm Thoma Bravo for $12.3 billion.

content: Retail investing platform Robinhood is setting sights on an EU expansion as part of broader plans to increase its global foothold.

title: China's stock surge has echoes of the 2015 bubble. What's different this time
content: The rocket up in Chinese stocks so far looks different from the market bubble in 2015, analysts said.

title: Japan's next prime minister is a career dissenter, but experts doubt he can govern as one
content: While Japan's next leader, Shigeru Ishiba, has been an outsider and Abenomics critic, it will be challenging to govern that way, some experts say.

content: South Korea, Hong Kong and mainland Chinese markets are closed for a public holiday Tuesday.

content: Chinese President Xi Jinping made no mention of specific countries or trade conflicts in his Monday speech and portrayed Beijing as upholding globalization.

title: Iran's response to Israel will be a choice between revenge and survival. Markets say it's choosing survival

title: Google to invest $1 billion in Thailand to build data center and accelerate AI growth
content: Google is investing 36 billion Thai baht, or $1 billion, into Thailand to build a new data center and expand its cloud infrastructure, the company said Monday.
summary: Google is investing 36 billion Thai baht, or $1 billion, into Thailand to build a new data center and expand its cloud infrastructure, the company said Monday.

title: China stocks just had their best day in 16 years, sending related U.S. ETFs soaring
content: The Shanghai Composite rallied 8.06% in its best day since September 2008.

title: AI chipmaker Cerebras files for IPO to take on Nvidia
content: Cerebras faces competition from Nvidia, as well as cloud providers that have developed in-house chips for running artificial intelligence models.
